#Text=4 .
#Text=Proposed Grouping Harmony Search for Virtual Machine Consolidation

#Text=This section described the detailed procedures of harmony search ( HS ) and grouping harmony search ( GHS ) , one of the metaheuristic techniques used to solve VMC , and the contents of the operators designed to efficiently solve VMC problems .
#Text=4.1 .
#Text=Overview of Harmony Search
#Text=HS is an optimization algorithm that was created based on the observation that better chords are produced by repeated practice in improvisation of jazz .
#Text=This refers to a series of processes that the most beautiful chords ( global optimum ) can be made through repetitive practice ( iteration ) when played by a variety of instruments .

#Text=In the case of GA , inspired by population genetics inspired by population genetics , generates new genes from two genes , but HS generates new solution from multiple solution , which has a high probability of searching for global optimal .
#Text=Compared to SA and TS , which are typical single solution based metaheuristics , population based HS has a high global search capability .
#Text=In the case of SA and TS , it is possible to drive a good quality through a mechanism that probabilistically adopts a bad solution .
#Text=When HS generates a new solution , it adopts a quality solution within the population and searches for an optimal solution .
#Text=HS consists of three operators in total : memory considering , pitch adjusting , and random playing .
#Text=Each operator determines the frequency of operation based on predefined parameter values .
#Text=The pseudo code of HS is shown in Table 1 .
#Text=HS generates one solution ( HM , harmony memory ) per iteration ( line 5 – 17 ) .
#Text=New Harmony x ’ is generated through memory considering , pitch adjusting , and random playing operators by increasing the index ( line 6 ) .
#Text=The operator of HS generates the first random number ( line 7 ) to determine whether to calculate the memory considering ( line 8 ) .
#Text=If the first random number is smaller than the predefined harmony memory considering rate ( HMCR ) , memory considering is executed .
#Text=If the first random number is larger than HMCR , random playing is executed ( line 13 ) .
#Text=Random playing is a method of adopting the value of one of the feasible solution groups .
#Text=Memory considering adopts the value of one of several solutions of harmony memory size ( HMS ) .
#Text=When the solution is generated through memory considering , the operation for pitch adjusting is determined by generating a second random number .
#Text=If the second random number is smaller than the predefined pitch adjusting rate ( PAR ) , pitch adjusting is executed ( line 10 ) .
#Text=Pitch adjusting means the neighboring value of the solution generated by memory considering .

#Text=The target value is calculated once x ’ is generated , and if it has a better value than the target value of the worst HM in the HMS , the solution is replaced with new harmony ( line 16 – 17 ) .
#Text=HS repeats the above process until the end condition is met .
#Text=4.2 .
#Text=Grouping Representation for Virtual Machine Consolidation

#Text=Harmony search is population-based metaheuristics that generate new HMs by combining multiple HMs and has the advantage of having a high degree of diversification ; however , as a result of controlling a large number of HMs , there is a disadvantage that computation times increase compared to single solution metaheuristics .
#Text=As the size of the node grows , the HMS also needs to grow to increase the efficiency of searching for a solution , so the problem occurs when handling a large-scale problem .
#Text=To solve this problem , we adopted grouping representation in this study for the efficient design of algorithms .
#Text=VMC belongs to grouping problems , and the ordering of objects within a group is meaningless .
#Text=In other words , the combination of VMs located in the PM is important , not the order in the group .
#Text=Since it also deals with virtualization environments , the number of PMs is basically smaller than the number of VMs .
#Text=Since there are multiple VMs in one PM , if the problem size is adjusted , the increase in VM is higher than the increase in PM .
#Text=If the solution is encoded in the permutation form of the VM , the length of the solution also increases as the number of VMs increases .
#Text=This method is inefficient when searching for a solution as the solution space is increased with many duplicate solution representations .
#Text=Therefore , PM-oriented representation is more efficient than VM-oriented solution representation .
#Text=Falkenauer proposed a one-gene-for-one-group method for one solution grouping problem .
#Text=With this in mind , this study represented PM and VM information based on groups as shown in
#Text=Figure 3
#Text=.
#Text=The index of each array indicates the index of PM , and the value of each array indicates the index of VM located in the corresponding PM , which is controlled in the form of a list .
#Text=4.3 .
#Text=Pitch Adjustments for Virtual Machine Consolidation
#Text=HS consists of three operators — memory considering , pitch adjustment , and randomization .
#Text=Among them , the operator that directly changes the new HM is pitch adjustment .
#Text=VMC has to decide the source PM selection , VM selection , and destination PM selection as a problem of migrating VM located in one PM to another PM .
#Text=The pitch adjustment operator changes the solution by determining the above three factors .
#Text=The criteria for determining each problem are as follows .
